description: From Middle English ribaldrie, from Old French ribaulderie, ribauderie, equivalent to ribald +â€Ž -ry.

entries.meaning: Joking or humorous language or behaviour used in a vulgar or lewd fashion.
examples: His jargon of slang was a continuous joy and surprise to them. His gestures, his strange poses, his frank ribaldry of tongue and principle fascinated them.
